<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/taliban-taking-afghanistan-drug-trade?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Taliban Advance Is Bad News for the Drug Trade
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Opium poppies grow near the border with Pakistan. (Photo by David Bathga..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjM4L2FmZ2hhbmlzdGFuX2p1bXAtc3RhcnRzX2EuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Bathgate/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Taliban, an Islamic fundamentalist group that brutally ruled Afghanistan in the late ’90s, has taken over <a href="https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/afghanistan-taliban-us-troops-intl-08-13-21/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than half</a> of Afghanistan’s provincial capitals as of yesterday evening, including the country’s second-largest city, Kandahar. Four cities fell to the Taliban’s rule Thursday night alone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Taliban’s advance comes months after President Biden announced plans to withdraw all US troops from the country to end the US’ longest-running war. But now, Biden’s sent 7,000 troops back to evacuate the American embassy and US citizens.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Afghanistan’s capital and largest city, Kabul, is still under government control, along with three other major Afghan cities—but one of those is currently under siege and the rest are being closed in on. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Taliban now effectively controls all of southern Afghanistan, and US officials told the NYT that the Biden administration is preparing for the possibility of the Afghan government </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/13/world/afghanistan-taliban?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collapsing</a></span><span> within the next month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the many ramifications of the Taliban’s onslaught: It could pour fuel on the illegal drug market.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The “world’s biggest cartel” is getting bigger</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even insurgents need capital to fuel their ventures, and the Taliban's <a href="https://theconversation.com/the-taliban-are-megarich-heres-where-they-get-the-money-they-use-to-wage-war-in-afghanistan-147411?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest source</a> of revenue is the drug trade. The organization made $416 million trafficking opium, heroin, and increasingly meth in fiscal year 2020, per the Conversation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And in the Afghan countryside now under Taliban control, opium poppies are in <a href="https://foreignpolicy.com/2021/07/19/taliban-expanding-drug-trade-meth-heroin/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">perpetual superbloom</a>. Afghanistan is the world's biggest producer of opium, which most heroin is derived from: 84% of all the world’s opium was sourced from the country from 2015–20, per the UN’s World Drug Report.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Taliban has also started peddling meth recently. And ephedra, a plant used to make methamphetamine, grows natively in Afghanistan.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the Taliban didn’t just beef up its drug supply. It also took over international crossing points to ramp up distribution, gaining access to Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Iran, and Pakistan. From those countries, drugs can be shipped to the rest of the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The Taliban’s power grab likely means more heroin and meth will be pushed into the hands of dealers and users around the world.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/economists-fall-plans-delta-variant?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Economists’ Fall Plans // The Delta Variant
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/economists-fall-plans-delta-variant?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Barnett and Amber from Love is Blind next to Jessica drinking wine" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjM3L2xvdmVfaXNfYmxpbmQucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US consumer sentiment plunged 13.5% from July to its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/us-consumer-sentiment-plummets-early-august-decade-low-2021-08-13/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest level since 2011</a>—yes, even lower than when they tried to make Barnett the most desirable man on <em>Love is Blind</em>. The dive was primarily sparked by concerns surrounding the Delta variant.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What exactly is “consumer sentiment”?</strong> Each month, the University of Michigan surveys 500 people across the continental US about how they’re feeling re: personal finances and business conditions. It’s one data point used to evaluate how the economy is faring.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened? </strong>The Michigan survey’s chief economist said such a dramatic change is an “emotional response, mainly from dashed hopes that the pandemic would end soon.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s not just consumers going blue. Only 39% of US small business owners said this month that they expect economic conditions to </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/delta-variant-drops-small-business-confidence-to-lowest-level-since-march-11628868656?mod=hp_lead_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">improve</a></span><span> in the next year, compared to 50% in July, per a study from Vistage Worldwide.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Surging Delta cases and reinstated mask mandates are giving Americans flashbacks to the early days of the pandemic. And some companies, such as Southwest Airlines, are saying that concerns about Delta are cramping the economic recovery. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/delta-upends-backtowork-plans-morning-brew-survey?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New Covid Wave Upends Back-to-Work Plans
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/delta-upends-backtowork-plans-morning-brew-survey?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Chart showing how the Delta variant caused companies to reassess back to work plans" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjMyL2NoYXJ0X29mX2JhY2tfdG9fd29ya19wbGFucy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nearly 47% of respondents to a Morning Brew survey said their employers are reconsidering return-to-office plans because of the spread of the Delta variant. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not only does that show how seriously employers are treating the latest Covid wave, but also how comfortable they are with remote work. Last quarter companies scored some of their best financial results ever...without employees seeing the inside of an office. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We posed several other questions to readers about remote work and the pandemic. Here’s what we learned:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Commutes are the worst: </strong></span><span>“No commute” was the top choice for what readers like most about working from home.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Offices are still empty: </strong></span><span>75% of respondents are working fully remote, while 20% head in a few times a week. 4.5% are fully in-person.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">People miss their coworkers: </strong></span><span>Readers said socializing with colleagues was the thing they missed most about not working in an office, followed by the opportunity to work in a different setting other than their house.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">But they like working from home: </strong></span><span>66% of readers said working from home during the pandemic was better than expected.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Just <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/203-cases-covid-19-linked-155236851.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">203 coronavirus cases</a> were found in connection to the Lollapalooza music festival several weeks ago, according to Chicago health officials, indicating “no sign of a ‘superspreader’ event.” The festival, attended by about 385,000 people, required proof of vaccination or a negative Covid test upon entrance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“It will be in textbooks.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How physiologist Leanne Redman described a new paper on metabolism to the NYT. The paper, published Thursday in Science, may have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/12/health/metabolism-weight-aging.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upended</a> what we thought we knew about metabolism, concluding that it doesn’t decrease from age 20 to 60 and that there are no real differences in the metabolic rates of men and women. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/money-matters-taking-plunge-house?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: Taking the Plunge on a House
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gingerbread house" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ir9ooRoyKZY8pRCJze/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gingerbread house" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ir9ooRoyKZY8pRCJze/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Note: </em></strong><em>Money Matters is moving. Author Ryan Lasker will continue answering reader questions (and more) in </em><em>a personal finance newsletter that starts next Tuesday. </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>You should sign up</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hey Ryan, when should I make the transition from renting an apartment to buying a house?—Tai from Texas</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I could write a mile-long column about this, but Neal told me I have 200 words. So here goes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few prereqs for buying a house: a solid credit score to qualify for a good mortgage rate, cash for maintenance and repairs (2%–4% of your home’s value), and no plans to move for a while. Oh, and some more cash for a down payment—somewhere between 5% and 20% of the purchase price.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Owning a home can make for a great investment. Median US home sale prices <a href="https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/MSPUS?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed</a> 46% between 2007—the height of the subprime mortgage crisis—and this June, per the St. Louis Fed. Real estate is a much less volatile investment than stocks, making it a better place to preserve wealth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">However, just because you <em>can </em>buy a house doesn’t mean you’re ready. For some, it’s much more appealing to rent so that you can dial up a landlord when your AC unit freezes over (<em>not </em>speaking from experience). The average HVAC unit is $7,000, and I cannot think of a more boring way to spend that much money.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Buy a house when you find the perfect place at the right price and are ready to take on the<em> </em>financial <em>and </em>physical responsibility.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>

</td>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzMvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, Brew’s Bookshelf brings you a few of our favorite business-related reads.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If Modern Monetary Theory confuses you, or if you've never even heard of that term before, let Stephanie Kelton break it down for you in her classic, </span><span><em><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781541736184?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Deficit Myth</a></em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Adam Harris's </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780062976482?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The State Must Provide</em></a></span><span> dives into the origin stories of America's colleges and universities.</span>
</li>
</ol>

</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Kick your career into gear: </strong>Morning Brew’s MB/A accelerator program takes the standard MBA, cuts out nearly all the cost and time, and offers the same networking opportunities, expert coaching, and hard skill development. The deadline to apply is tomorrow, so <a href="https://accelerator.morningbrew.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check it out right now</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Back to work: </strong>As part of our series on Covid and the workplace, we speak with unvaccinated workers returning to the office—and explore how employers are dealing with it. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/14/vaccine-convo-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Conversation starters: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">

Disney got a small boost after revealing its US parks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/12/disney-dis-fiscal-q3-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturned to profitability\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA CDC panel \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2021/08/13/1027461542/cdc-panel-recommends-3rd-covid-vaccine-dose-for-immunocompromised-people?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecommended\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a booster shot for people with weakened immune systems yesterday, following authorization by the FDA a day earlier. (Photo by David Bathga...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjM4L2FmZ2hhbmlzdGFuX2p1bXAtc3RhcnRzX2EuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDavid Bathgate/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Taliban, an Islamic fundamentalist group that brutally ruled Afghanistan in the late ’90s, has taken over \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/afghanistan-taliban-us-troops-intl-08-13-21/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than half\u003c/a\u003e of Afghanistan’s provincial capitals as of yesterday evening, including the country’s second-largest city, Kandahar. Four cities fell to the Taliban’s rule Thursday night alone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Taliban’s advance comes months after President Biden announced plans to withdraw all US troops from the country to end the US’ longest-running war. But now, Biden’s sent 7,000 troops back to evacuate the American embassy and US citizens.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfghanistan’s capital and largest city, Kabul, is still under government control, along with three other major Afghan cities—but one of those is currently under siege and the rest are being closed in on. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Taliban now effectively controls all of southern Afghanistan, and US officials told the NYT that the Biden administration is preparing for the possibility of the Afghan government \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/13/world/afghanistan-taliban?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollapsing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e within the next month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the many ramifications of the Taliban’s onslaught: It could pour fuel on the illegal drug market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe “world’s biggest cartel” is getting bigger\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven insurgents need capital to fuel their ventures, and the Taliban's \u003ca href=\"https://theconversation.com/the-taliban-are-megarich-heres-where-they-get-the-money-they-use-to-wage-war-in-afghanistan-147411?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest source\u003c/a\u003e of revenue is the drug trade. The organization made $416 million trafficking opium, heroin, and increasingly meth in fiscal year 2020, per the Conversation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd in the Afghan countryside now under Taliban control, opium poppies are in \u003ca href=\"https://foreignpolicy.com/2021/07/19/taliban-expanding-drug-trade-meth-heroin/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eperpetual superbloom\u003c/a\u003e. Afghanistan is the world's biggest producer of opium, which most heroin is derived from: 84% of all the world’s opium was sourced from the country from 2015–20, per the UN’s World Drug Report.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Taliban has also started peddling meth recently. And ephedra, a plant used to make methamphetamine, grows natively in Afghanistan.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the Taliban didn’t just beef up its drug supply. It also took over international crossing points to ramp up distribution, gaining access to Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Iran, and Pakistan. From those countries, drugs can be shipped to the rest of the world. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e The Taliban’s power grab likely means more heroin and meth will be pushed into the hands of dealers and users around the world.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS consumer sentiment plunged 13.5% from July to its \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/us-consumer-sentiment-plummets-early-august-decade-low-2021-08-13/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elowest level since 2011\u003c/a\u003e—yes, even lower than when they tried to make Barnett the most desirable man on \u003cem\u003eLove is Blind\u003c/em\u003e. The dive was primarily sparked by concerns surrounding the Delta variant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat exactly is “consumer sentiment”?\u003c/strong\u003e Each month, the University of Michigan surveys 500 people across the continental US about how they’re feeling re: personal finances and business conditions. It’s one data point used to evaluate how the economy is faring.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened? \u003c/strong\u003eThe Michigan survey’s chief economist said such a dramatic change is an “emotional response, mainly from dashed hopes that the pandemic would end soon.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s not just consumers going blue. Only 39% of US small business owners said this month that they expect economic conditions to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/delta-variant-drops-small-business-confidence-to-lowest-level-since-march-11628868656?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimprove\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the next year, compared to 50% in July, per a study from Vistage Worldwide.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Surging Delta cases and reinstated mask mandates are giving Americans flashbacks to the early days of the pandemic. And some companies, such as Southwest Airlines, are saying that concerns about Delta are cramping the economic recovery. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNearly 47% of respondents to a Morning Brew survey said their employers are reconsidering return-to-office plans because of the spread of the Delta variant. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot only does that show how seriously employers are treating the latest Covid wave, but also how comfortable they are with remote work. Last quarter companies scored some of their best financial results ever...without employees seeing the inside of an office. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe posed several other questions to readers about remote work and the pandemic. Here’s what we learned:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCommutes are the worst: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“No commute” was the top choice for what readers like most about working from home.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOffices are still empty: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e75% of respondents are working fully remote, while 20% head in a few times a week. 4.5% are fully in-person.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePeople miss their coworkers: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReaders said socializing with colleagues was the thing they missed most about not working in an office, followed by the opportunity to work in a different setting other than their house.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut they like working from home: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e66% of readers said working from home during the pandemic was better than expected.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eNote: \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eMoney Matters is moving. Author Ryan Lasker will continue answering reader questions (and more) in \u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003ea personal finance newsletter that starts next Tuesday. \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eYou should sign up\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHey Ryan, when should I make the transition from renting an apartment to buying a house?—Tai from Texas\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI could write a mile-long column about this, but Neal told me I have 200 words. So here goes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA few prereqs for buying a house: a solid credit score to qualify for a good mortgage rate, cash for maintenance and repairs (2%–4% of your home’s value), and no plans to move for a while. Oh, and some more cash for a down payment—somewhere between 5% and 20% of the purchase price.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOwning a home can make for a great investment. Median US home sale prices \u003ca href=\"https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/MSPUS?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbed\u003c/a\u003e 46% between 2007—the height of the subprime mortgage crisis—and this June, per the St. Louis Fed. Real estate is a much less volatile investment than stocks, making it a better place to preserve wealth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHowever, just because you \u003cem\u003ecan \u003c/em\u003ebuy a house doesn’t mean you’re ready. For some, it’s much more appealing to rent so that you can dial up a landlord when your AC unit freezes over (\u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003espeaking from experience). The average HVAC unit is $7,000, and I cannot think of a more boring way to spend that much money.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBuy a house when you find the perfect place at the right price and are ready to take on the\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003efinancial \u003cem\u003eand \u003c/em\u003ephysical responsibility.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
